title: Google Sign-In Successful Authentication
description: Test the successful Google social login flow using Firebase Authentication, ensuring JWT token retrieval and dashboard redirection.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Click on the Google Sign-In button.
Complete the Google OAuth flow successfully.
Verify that Firebase user token is obtained.
Verify that the JWT token is requested and received from backend via SocialLoginUseCase.
Verify that the JWT token is securely stored in session/local storage.
Verify that the user is redirected to the dashboard page.

title: Google Sign-In Cancellation Handling
description: Verify that cancelling the Google OAuth login process is handled gracefully with appropriate user feedback.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Click on the Google Sign-In button.
Cancel the Google OAuth login process before completion.
Verify that the application shows an appropriate snackbar message indicating login was cancelled.
Verify that no JWT token or user session is created.

title: Google Sign-In Error Handling on Authentication Failure
description: Tests the scenario where Google sign-in fails due to errors such as network issues or invalid client configuration and proper error feedback is given.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Click on the Google Sign-In button.
Simulate Google OAuth failure (e.g., network failure or invalid credentials).
Check that an error snackbar with user-friendly message is shown.
Verify that no user session or JWT token is stored.

title: Responsive Google Sign-In Button UI States
description: Verify Google Sign-In button component UI states (loading, success, error) are displayed correctly and is responsive across screen sizes.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Trigger Google Sign-In loading state.
Verify loading spinner or indicator is visible on the button.
Simulate sign-in success state.
Verify success feedback (e.g., button color change or icon) is displayed.
Simulate sign-in error state.
Verify error indicator or message on the button is shown.
Resize browser window to multiple common screen sizes.
Verify button remains fully visible, functional and uses Material3 styling correctly.

title: Sidebar Menu Role-Based Access Control
description: Verify sidebar menu items are filtered and displayed correctly according to the authenticated userâ€™s role and permissions.

steps.description: Login as a user with Role A.
Verify that only menu items permitted for Role A are visible.
Login as a user with Role B.
Verify that only menu items permitted for Role B are visible.
Login as a user with multiple roles or elevated permissions.
Verify that the sidebar correctly merges and displays all allowed menu items.

title: Sidebar Navigation Selection and Visual Feedback
description: Verify smooth navigation on menu item selection, with correct route updates, selection highlights, visual animations and badge displays.

steps.description: Login and load sidebar menu.
Click on each available menu item sequentially.
Verify the application navigates to the correct route for each click.
Check that the clicked menu item visually shows as selected with highlight/animation.
Check that menu badge counts (if any) are displayed correctly.

title: User Avatar Display with Role and Business Type Formatting
description: Verify that the user avatar in the sidebar correctly displays with proper role and business type formatting.

steps.description: Login as a user with role and business type metadata.
Check that avatar is shown in sidebar.
Verify that the displayed role and business type labels (e.g., text, badges) are correct and formatted properly.

title: Logout Flow and Session Clearance
description: Verify user can trigger logout from the dashboard and session tokens are cleared securely, redirecting to login.

steps.description: Login successfully and load dashboard.
Trigger the logout action via sidebar or profile section.
Verify the user session and JWT token are cleared from storage.
Verify the app redirects the user back to the login page.

title: Error Feedback for Backend Validation Failures
description: Validate that backend errors during JWT token validation or API calls are shown to the user with detailed but user-friendly snackbars.

steps.description: Simulate backend validation failure during token retrieval or API call.
Verify the user sees a snackbar with appropriate error message without app crash.
Verify retry mechanisms or options are provided if applicable.

title: Environment Configuration Loading and Initialization
description: Verify environment variables such as client IDs and Firebase SDK configurations load properly and initialize the app without errors.

steps.description: Start the application with given environment configurations.
Verify Firebase SDK initializes correctly.
Verify environment-specific variables such as OAuth client IDs are loaded and used.
Check that no initialization or configuration errors appear in logs or UI.

title: Logging Behavior During Authentication and Navigation
description: Verify that all key lifecycle events, authentication states, and navigation actions are logged for debugging and monitoring purposes.

steps.description: Perform a complete login flow including social authentication.
Navigate through multiple sidebar menu items.
Check application logs include detailed records of login attempts, token retrieval, role-based menu filtering, and navigation actions.
Verify that errors (if any) in authentication or navigation are logged with details.

title: Compatibility Across Supported Web Browsers
description: Validate that the social login flow, sidebar navigation, and UI components function as expected on all supported web browsers.

steps.description: Open the application on supported browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari).
Execute complete Google Sign-In and dashboard navigation flows.
Verify no functional or visual errors occur in all tested browsers.
Verify UI responsiveness and Material3 compliance across browsers.

title: Scalability of Menu with Dynamic Items and Future Features
description: Test adding new menu items and dynamic badge features to ensure the architecture supports maintainability and future expansion without regression.

steps.description: Add a new menu group and items programmatically with badges.
Verify the new menu items appear correctly, filtered by roles as applicable.
Check that badges display with animations correctly.
Navigate to newly added routes from sidebar.
Verify smooth navigation and visual feedback remain consistent.
